title: Lemon Pepper Glass Noodles
ingredients: - 8 ounces dried wide glass noodles (made from sweet potato or “green bean”)
- 1 scallion, trimmed, halved lengthwise, and cut into 2-inch pieces
- 1½ lemons, quartered, seeded, and sliced ¼ inch thick
directions: 1. Soak the noodles in a few inches of warm water for 30 minutes to soften. Gently pull them apart if necessary, then drain well.
2. Put the oil and scallions in a wok or heavy skillet and set over high heat. Let the oil sizzle and cook until the scallions turn brown, about 1 minute.
3. Add the noodles and stir until they soften further and become translucent, about 20 seconds.
4. Stir in the white wine, black bean sauce, and black pepper. Let it come to a boil and cook, stirring occasionally, until the noodles are tender and the sauce reduces to glaze them, about 1 minute.
5. Remove the wok from the heat. Add the lemon slices, chives, and sesame seeds and toss well.
